Name: gpt-driven_cooperation_in_agent-based_simulations
Title: How can we use gpt to empower agent based simulations to understand human cooperation
Experiment: Equip agents in the simulation with GPT modules to enable complex decision-making based on learned human cooperation data. Continuously adjust the complexity and constraints of the simulation environment (e.g., resource availability, social norms) to test the adaptability and effectiveness of GPT-driven strategies in real-time. Measure the success of cooperation strategies through outcomes like resource distribution efficiency and conflict resolution rates.
Results: Agents powered by GPT exhibit more nuanced and effective cooperative strategies under dynamically changing conditions, providing deeper insights into the mechanisms of human cooperation.
